Reviews.Title: Great aid for travelling on your own
Reviews.Author: M. Pascal
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot by myself and I frequently got frustrated for the really bad pictures that other people take when you ask them (it's great that they take a minute of their time to take a picture of a stranger, but to be honest most of the pictures taken by strangers aren't good ones).I'm not really good at self-shots with my arm extended (I guess my arms aren't long enough) and I had been looking (for at least 2 years literally) for a small mirror that I could attach to my camera (I tried with a "mirror finish" cover for touch screen devices and a couple of other alternate ideas, but I wasn't satisfied).When I saw this article on Amazon I decided to give it a try and I couldn't be more satisfied, it has helped me a LOT to get better pictures of myself (or a small group of people).It's really easy to attach to your camera, the entire process should take about 2-3 minutes from the point you open the package until you're done with installation (just like with any other self-adhesive item, check that the spot where you'll stick it to is clean and dry before you stick and you'll be fine).I bought 2 of these ones for the couple of point&shoot; cameras I use most often and I'll surely be purchasing more for the cameras I get in the future.

Reviews.Title: Awesome-just like cell phone reflectors
Reviews.Author: J P
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, works great to take pictures of yourself with kids, friends, and get it in frame the first time!

Reviews.Title: Metalized plastic mirror. Cheap construction, but does the job
Reviews.Author: canyon "canyon"
Reviews.Content: Can't find anything else easily in the US. So I settle. But the part is low quality.Make sure you align the mirror closest to the lens, or the same axis to the lens.
